insights.male: Men generally prefer women ~2 years younger or more; preference stays consistent across late 20s–40s. Age gap tolerance wider.
insights.female: Women tend to prefer partners close in age; younger women prefer slightly older, older women sometimes lean younger if stable.

insights.male: Men often prefer partners earning less; prioritize lifestyle and family goals over earnings. Some discomfort if wife earns more.
insights.female: Income and career trajectory are major factors; financial stability is attractive. Hypergamy trends persist.

insights.shared: Both genders show strong caste/religion preference; ~90–95% of marriages are within caste. Religion mismatches have higher resistance for women.

insights.male: Men prefer local matches but value relocation flexibility. Career moves often male-led.
insights.female: Many women expect relocation at marriage, but career-oriented women prefer local or partner-willing-to-relocate options.

insights.male: Many men want kids; less likely to link parenthood to career cost. Unsure responses are flexible.
insights.female: Career-focused women may delay or opt out of kids; 'never' is often a firm choice. Timing matters.

insights.male: Education matters less than for women but still preferred if similar; prestige and network value exist.
insights.female: Women often seek equal or higher education levels; high-prestige college backgrounds increase match value.

insights.male: Career prestige respected but secondary to other factors.
insights.female: Strong emphasis on company prestige and career growth trajectory.

insights.male: Never-married preferred; more open to remarriage than women.
insights.female: Divorced/widowed men often seen as more available than divorced women in traditional contexts.

insights.shared: Having siblings is generally seen positively; only-child stereotypes exist.
Language compatibility aids cultural fit and communication; primary+secondary match preferred.

insights.male: Height is less critical; small preference for shorter women.
insights.female: Women more sensitive to height; usually prefer taller men.

insights.shared: Minor but lifestyle-relevant preference; pet alignment avoids future friction.
